name: wispily
content:
wispily adverb
(THIN)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is thin and delicate, like a small, thin line of cloud, smoke, steam, etc.: Smoke rose wispily from the end of her cigarette. The clothes must be intended for wispily thin models since they are only available in small sizes.
(of hair) thin and not growing thickly: Her hair drooped wispily over her eyes and she had to tuck it behind her ear. A wispily bearded young man was at the door.
More examplesFewer examplesSmoke swirled wispily around when they opened the door.

wispily adverb
(NOT LOUD/STRONG)
in a way that is not loud or strong: The shy girl wispily gave her name and was asked by the judge to repeat herself. A few feeble leaves wispily hung off the few dried branches.
